    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String ArabicNumber()
      Public method that returns a formatted string of the Arabic number if it is between 1 and 3999 If the number is not between 1 and 3999, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown
      void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      Public method which listens for keys pressed by the user
      void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      Public method which listens for keys released by the user Whatever text is in the Roman text area is converted to all upper-case and then is used to set the Arabic text area to the correct Arabic Number after being converted by the letterConverion method
      void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      Public method which listens for keys typed by the user

    • Method Detail

      • letterConversion

        public void letterConversion(java.lang.String romanNumeral)
        Runs the letter conversion on a Roman numeral into an Arabic number. Result is set to a different number variable to allow for valid Roman numeral entry and the result is printed to the Arabic textArea
        Parameters:
        romanNumeral - The String of characters that represent a Roman Numeral

      • ArabicNumber

        public java.lang.String ArabicNumber()
        Public method that returns a formatted string of the Arabic number if it is between 1 and 3999 If the number is not between 1 and 3999, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown
        Returns:
        Formatted string of the Arabic number if it is between 1 and 3999

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Public method which listens for keys released by the user Whatever text is in the Roman text area is converted to all upper-case and then is used to set the Arabic text area to the correct Arabic Number after being converted by the letterConverion method
